abstract: Judge George H King of United States District Court in Los Angeles rules copyright on song Happy Birthday to You is invalid; copyright for tune, most popular one in English language, has long been held by music publisher Warner/Chappell and its parent company Warner Music Group, which still make $2 million per year in licensing fees from it; if King's ruling stands, song will become part of public domain.
lead_paragraph: The decision is a blow to the music publisher Warner/Chappell and its parent, the Warner Music Group, which reportedly still collect some $2 million annually in licensing fees.
snippet: The decision is a blow to the music publisher Warner/Chappell and its parent, the Warner Music Group, which reportedly still collect some $2 million annually in licensing fees.
